title: Richard Wadge
text: Richard Henry Wadge (1864–1923) was an English <a href="association%20football">football</a> manager who managed <a href="Burnley%20F.C.">Burnley</a> for a short spell in 1910. Born in <a href="Liskeard">Liskeard</a>, <a href="Cornwall">Cornwall</a>, he initially joined Burnley as a <a href="Board%20of%20directors">director</a> before taking charge of the first team for three matches following the death of former manager <a href="Spen%20Whittaker">Spen Whittaker</a>. His first match in charge was the 0–1 defeat to <a href="Glossop%20North%20End%20A.F.C.">Glossop</a> at <a href="Turf%20Moor">Turf Moor</a> on 18 April 1910. Five days later, the team drew 1–1 with <a href="Leicester%20Fosse%20F.C.">Leicester Fosse</a> and his final match in charge was the 3–0 victory at home to <a href="Lincoln%20City%20F.C.">Lincoln City</a> on 30 April 1910, which was the final match of the 1909–10 season. He subsequently returned to his role as a director and was replaced as manager by <a href="John%20Haworth">John Haworth</a> prior to the start of the 1910–11 campaign. Wadge died in London in 1923, at the age of 59.
